alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wichita and northeastern Greeley Counties through 630 PM MDT/730 PM CDT/... At 557 PM MDT/657 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Tribune, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wichita and northeastern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
